intro: Gonolobus cuajayote, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its twining stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces vibrant blue or purple flowers that open in the morning and close in the afternoon. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a velvety texture, while its seeds are enclosed in a fibrous, spiny capsule. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in some indigenous cultures.
